result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakacher Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 3 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA surcharge is waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with CVS Pharmacy located in Menomonee Falls or Dr. Najeeb's Office.

timeConds.notes:
Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.
STAYED - To be used at Agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dakacher Ray

records.addlTxt: Crime Victim Restitution Form, received and filed in court by the State.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dakacher Ray in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  

State moves to amend count 2 to Obtaining a Prescription Drug w/Fraud 450.11(7)(a).
Defense has no objetions.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read in.




Court orders the following:
125 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
3 Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  9 Months.
Court will allow for Transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  CVS Pharmacy located in Menomonee Falls or Dr. Najeeb's Office.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $248
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME:
20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
STAYED - To be used at the agent's discretion.
Demand for Discovery with attached demand for Jury- filed by Attorney Wolff.

Defendant appeared in court, therefore, no capias will be issued.

State has no objection. Court grants the request.   Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint including the Walgreens or CVS Pharmacy in Menomonee Falls or the Dr office listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
